block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Nassau and Suffolk Counties this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com, or by mail to Long Island Weekly, 620 Eighth Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10018.
FILM
Huntington ''La Vie en Rose,'' Olivier Dahan's portrait of Edith Piaf. Starting Friday. $6 and $9; $4.50, children under 12. Cinema Arts Center, 423 Park Avenue. (631) 423-7611.
Southampton ''Leonard Cohen: I'm Your Man,'' tribute to the musician. Friday at 8 p.m. $5 and $7. Parrish Art Museum, 25 Job's Lane. (631) 283-2118, Extension 32.
FOR CHILDREN

Garden City Reel Fun at LICM: ''Happily N'ever After,'' evildoers try to take over Fairy Tale Land. 3 and up. June 17 at 1:30 p.m. ''Long Island Fishing Trip!'' Fish and learn about bluefish, black sea bass and others. June 17 at 12:30 and 2:30 p.m. $3, with museum admission; $2, members. Long Island Children's Museum, 11 Davis Avenue. (516) 224-5800.

Huntington Cinema for Kids! Series: ''Bridge to Terabithia,'' directed by Gabor Csupo. After the screening, David Paterson, the screenwriter, will talk about the movie. June 24 at 1 p.m. $7 and $9; children under 12, $4.50. Cinema Arts Center, 423 Park Avenue. (631) 423-7611.
Riverhead ''Ancient Eggs,'' exhibition of fossilized dinosaur eggs. Through Sept. 3. Hours: Daily, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Dinosaur Walk Museum, 221 East Main Street. (631) 369-6556.

Stony Brook Family Game Shindig, featuring games, music and a tour of the exhibition ''Living the American Dream.'' Friday at 4 p.m. $6 and $7; $3, students. Long Island Museum of American Art, History and Carriages, 1200 Route 25A. (631) 751-0066.
MUSIC AND DANCE
Farmingdale The Bouncing Souls, punk rock. June 23 at 4:30 p.m. $14 and $15. Crazy Donkey, 1058 Route 110. (631) 753-1975.
Great River Pat Wictor, guitarist. June 17 at 2 p.m. Free; $6 parking fee. Red Molly, folk music. June 24 at 2 p.m. Free. Bayard Cutting Arboretum State Park, 440 Montauk Highway. (631) 224-5420.
Huntington Jefferson Starship. June 23 at 7 p.m. Inter-Media Art Center, 370 New York Avenue. (631) 549-2787.
Southold Concerts at the Bend: Trio featuring the violinist Linda Sinanian. June 24 at 4 p.m. $15; $10, students. First Universalist Church of Southold, 221 Main Road. (631) 765-3494.

Westbury Lynyrd Skynyrd, southern rock. Tuesday and Wednesday at 8 p.m. $56.50 to $66.50. Charlie Daniels Band and Marshall Tucker Band. Friday at 8 p.m. $46.50 to $56.50. John Kay and Steppenwolf Farewell Tour with Rick Derringer. June 23 at 8 p.m. $50 to $60. North Fork Theater, 960 Brush Hollow Road. (516) 334-0800.
SPOKEN WORD
Holbrook ''I Love to Cry at Weddings,'' a look at love and marriage through the short story. Monday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Sachem Public Library, 150 Holbrook Library. (631) 588-5024.

Huntington Stephen Greenberg, author of ''A Little Nip, A Little Tuck.'' Monday at 8 p.m. Free. Sarah Beth Durst, author of ''Into the Wild.'' Thursday at 8 p.m. Free. Book Revue, 313 New York Avenue. (631) 271-1442.

Long Beach ''Seeking a Secure Retirement,'' a discussion with James Verdi, certified financial planner, and others. Thursday at 2:30 p.m. Long Beach Public Library, 111 West Park Avenue. (516) 432-7201.
Southampton Poetry writing workshop, including group discussion. Thursday at 6 p.m. $75 and $55. Parrish Art Museum, 25 Job's Lane. (631) 283-2118, Extension 32.

Stony Brook John J. Head, author of ''Brush and Bridle: Richard Newton Jr. -- Artist and Equestrian,'' will talk and sign books. June 24 at 2 p.m. Long Island Museum of American Art, History and Carriages, 1200 Route 25A. (631) 751-0066.
THEATER
Bellport ''Cold As Ice,'' on-ice musical by Frank D'Agostino, performed by Oksana Baiul and other skaters. Through June 17. $39 to $43. Gateway Playhouse, 215 South Country Road. (631) 286-1133.
Cherry Grove, Fire Island ''Blowing Whistles,'' by Matthew Todd. June 23 through July 15. $25. Tides Playhouse, Ocean Walk. (631) 597-9439.
East Farmingdale ''Killjoy,'' a comedy about marriage by Jerry Mayer. Through July 8. $18 to $22. Arena Players Main Stage Theater, 296 Route 109. (516) 293-0674.
Elmont Lerner and Loewe's ''My Fair Lady.'' Through June 23. $14 to $28. BroadHollow Theater, 700 Hempstead Turnpike. (631) 581-2700.
Hempstead ''Tess,'' a musical version of Thomas Hardy's ''Tess of the d'Urbervilles.'' Through June 17. $18 and $20; $15, non-Hofstra students. Spiegel Theater, Hofstra University. (516) 463-6644.
Lindenhurst ''Sideman'' by Warren Leight, presented by the BroadHollow Theater Company. Through June 24. $14 to $22. Studio Theater, 141 South Wellwood Avenue. (631) 581-2700.

Oakdale The Who's rock opera, ''Tommy.'' Through July 1. $18 and $20; $16, students. ''Seussical the Musical,'' based on the books of Dr. Seuss. Through July 1. $12. CM Performing Arts Center, 931 Montauk Highway. (631) 218-2810.
Port Jefferson Bob Fosse's ''Sweet Charity.'' Through Wednesday. $20 to $28. Theater Three, 412 Main Street. (631) 928-9100.
Quogue Léocadia,'' by Jean Anouilh, presented by the Hampton Theater Company. Through June 17. $18 and $20; students, $10. Quogue Community Hall, 126 Jessup Avenue. (631) 653-8955.
OUTDOORS
Garden City ''AirPlay.'' Air race and air mazes. Through Sept. 2, Tuesday through Friday, at 10 a.m. $8 and $9. Long Island Children's Museum, 11 Davis Avenue. (516) 224-5800.

Huntington ''Introduction to Wilderness Survival.'' Learn how to find food, start a fire and build a shelter. June 17 at 9:30 a.m. $3; reservations required. Caumsett State Historic Park, 25 Lloyd Harbor Road. (631) 423-1770.
COMEDY
Port Washington Long Island Comedy Festival, featuring five comedians. Friday at 8:30 p.m. $30 and $35. Jeanne Rimsky Theater at the Landmark on Main Street, 232 Main Street. (516) 767-6444.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES
Bellport ''Contrast and Harmony,'' work by LuAnn Thompson and Chris Taylor. Through June 30. Wednesdays through Saturdays, at 11 a.m. Phoenix Fine Art Gallery, 139 South Country Road. (631) 776-0811.
Cold Spring Harbor ''Toys, Kids and Boats,'' exhibition of children's toys from the whaling era. Through Aug. 31. $3 and $4; children under 5, free. Whaling Museum, Route 25A. (631) 367-3418.
East Hampton ''Dan Flavin: An Intimate View,'' works from the late 1960s. Through July 29. $4 and $5; members, free. Guild Hall, 158 Main Street. (631) 324-4050.

East Hampton Drawings by Linda Etcoff and Clifford Ross. Through July 9. Hours: Mondays and Thursdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. The Drawing Room, 16R Newtown Lane. (631) 324-5016.

East Islip ''Site Specifics '07,'' an exhibition of installations and mixed media work. Through July 29. ''Free Play,'' art that explores fantasy. Wednesday through Sept. 9. $5. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Islip Art Museum, 50 Irish Lane. (631) 224-5402.

Greenport ''Habitats,'' a benefit art show for Habitat for Humanity. Through June 24. Hours: Fridays, 3 to 7 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. DeCordova Studio and Gallery, 538 Main Street. (631) 477-0620.

Greenport ''Dark/Stones/Standing,'' photography and photogravure by Barbara Yoshida and metal folk sculpture by Fritz Cass. Through July 5. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, noon to 7 p.m. Sirens' Song Gallery, 516 Main Street. (631) 477-1021.
Huntington ''Vaux,'' works by Richard, Sandra and Joe Vaux. Through July 7. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 11:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. Alpan Gallery, 2 West Carver Street. (631) 423-4433.

Huntington ''A Time for Reflection,'' photographs by Seth Kalmowitz. Through July 1. Hours: Fridays, 5 to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, noon to 9 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Fotofoto Gallery, 372 New York Avenue. (631) 549-0448.

Huntington Station ''Head to Head,'' paintings by Ennid Berger. Through June 22. Hours: Mondays, Tuesdays and Fridays, 9 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Wednesdays, 10 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. South Huntington Public Library, 145 Pidgeon Hill Road. (631) 549-4411.
Port Jefferson ''Intuition: A Five Woman Show,'' painting and photography. Through June 24. Gallery 4222, 318 Wynn Lane. (631) 473-5422.

Quogue ''Visual Poetry, Vivid Color,'' works of photorealism by Charles Wildbank. Through July 1. Hours: Sundays and Mondays, noon to 5 p.m.; Tuesdays and Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Fridays and Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Quogue Library Art Gallery, 90 Quogue Street. (631) 653-4224.

Riverhead ''Duality,'' an all-media art show. Through July 13. Free. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. East End Arts Council Gallery, 133 East Main Street. (631) 727-0900.

Rockville Centre ''Irrevocable,'' works by graduating senior art students. Through June 30. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Molloy College Art Gallery, 1000 Hempstead Avenue. (516) 678-5000.

Roslyn Harbor ''Dreams on Canvas: Surrealism in Europe and America.'' ''Art to Touch,'' three-dimensional glass reproductions of works by Matisse, Marin and others. ''The Music of Regret and Other Works,'' photographs by Laurie Simmons. All through Aug. 12. $10; seniors, $8; children, $4. ''Private Tea and Tour,'' a private tour of the exhibit ''Dreams on Canvas: Surrealism in Europe and America.'' Wednesday through July 18. $30; $25, members. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. Nassau County Museum of Art, 1 Museum Drive. (516) 484-9337.

Sea Cliff ''Something Old, Something New, Vintage Wedding Gowns on View,'' gowns and accessories from the 1870s to the 1950s. Through July 4. $1. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, 2 to 5 p.m. Sea Cliff Museum, 95 Tenth Avenue. (516) 671-0090.

Shelter Island ''M.A.L.E. (More Abstract Linear Expressions),'' paintings by Jason Willaford. Through Monday. Hours: Thursdays through Tuesdays, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Boltax.Gallery, 21 North Ferry Road. (631) 749-4062.
Southampton ''Three East End Photographers,'' large-format photos of the South Fork. Through June 25. Hours: Daily, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Bravura Art and Objects, 22 Nugent Street. (631) 259-2605.

Southampton ''Studio as Muse,'' three exhibitions that explore the artist's studio. Through Aug. 5. $5 and $7; children under 18, free. ''An Evening at Wölffer Estates,'' wine and regional food. Wednesday at 6 p.m. $35; $25, members. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Parrish Art Museum, 25 Job's Lane. (631) 283-2118, Extension 32.
Southampton Paintings by Jeff Muhs. June 23 through July 2. Reception: June 23 at 6 p.m. Hours: Thursdays through Mondays, noon to 5 p.m. RVS Fine Art, 20 Job's Lane. (631) 283-8546.

Stony Brook ''Living the American Dream: Levittown and the Suburban Boom,'' exhibition exploring the history of suburbanization on Long Island. Through July 8. ''William Sidney Mount: The Education of an Artist.'' Mount paintings are paired with works that inspired them. Through Sept. 30. $6 and $7; students, $3. Hours: Wednesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Long Island Museum of American Art, History and Carriages, 1200 Route 25A. (631) 751-0066.

A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Nassau and Suffolk Counties this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com, or by mail to Long Island Weekly, 620 Eighth Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10018.

Huntington ''A Time for Reflection,'' photographs by Seth Kalmowitz. Through July 1. Hours: Fridays, 5 to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, noon to 9 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Fotofoto Gallery, 372 New York Avenue. (631) 549-0448.

Huntington Station ''Head to Head,'' paintings by Ennid Berger. Through June 22. Hours: Mondays, Tuesdays and Fridays, 9 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Wednesdays, 10 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. South Huntington Public Library, 145 Pidgeon Hill Road. (631) 549-4411.

Quogue ''Visual Poetry, Vivid Color,'' works of photorealism by Charles Wildbank. Through July 1. Hours: Sundays and Mondays, noon to 5 p.m.; Tuesdays and Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Fridays and Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Quogue Library Art Gallery, 90 Quogue Street. (631) 653-4224.
